title: Ticket #4433: Add syntax to allow users to append to configuration arrays
description:
In the HTCondor-CE, we set JOB_ROUTER_DEFAULTS for our users but they can't append additional values to those defaults. Currently, they're adding the default values they wanted to each individual route, which is tedious and annoying. We would like to see something like the following so that our users can write clearer configs:

JOB_ROUTER_DEFAULTS = ($JOB_ROUTER_DEFAULT), [AccountingGroup = undefined;]
remarks:
2014-Sep-03 21:21:47 by bbockelm:
Proposed implementation pushed to branch V8_3-gt4433. Tested on a local job router but needs review.

2014-Sep-10 14:55:02 by johnkn:

for JOB_ROUTER_DEFAULTS all we have to do to fix the problem is make the outer [] optional, but parse as if the were there.

For JOB_ROUTER_ENTRIES we should allow multiple knobs, one per router, with the outer [] once again being impled.

I also propose that we switch to a better naming scheme. 

    JOB_ROUTER_ENTRY_1 = a=1; b=2;
    JOB_ROUTER_ENTRY_TWO = a=2; b=3;

Once again, outer [] are optional to facilitate appending. but in this case, all knobs matching the JOB_ROUTER_ENTRY pattern are parsed, and each knob defines exactly one ad.

2014-Sep-16 10:57:02 by johnkn:
patch [41164] makes the square braces around the classad value optional for JOB_ROUTER_DEFAULTS knob.

2014-Sep-17 15:44:21 by bbockelm:
Hi TJ,

Can we hold off on the JOB_ROUTER_ENTRY change? I'd like to think a little bit bigger picture (separate ticket at least), as we already have three ways to specify routes. Seems like we should maybe have a slightly higher threshold to add a fourth mechanism.

Brian

2014-Sep-18 09:34:15 by johnkn:
Agreed. Looks like the JOB_ROUTER_ENTRY change isn't needed at this time.

2014-Nov-17 20:30:09 by bbockelm:
Hi,

Returning to this one -

I don't consider this resolved because, due to backward compatibility issues, I don't see how OSG could utilize the provided solution.

Right now, since HTCondor-CE doesn't know the underlying HTCondor version, we have to keep the brackets on JOB_ROUTER_DEFAULTS. In order to compose multiple JOB_ROUTER_DEFAULTS entries, you have to remove the brackets from all.

The originally posted patch didn't have this problem.

For record keeping - should we reopen this ticket or file a new one?

Brian

ToddT: we are reopening this ticket

2014-Nov-21 10:08:44 by bbockelm:
Thanks TJ!

Looking at the code - should we default this to off:

MERGE_JOB_ROUTER_DEFAULT_AD

and put the onus on HTCondor-CE to enable it? This would mean, by default, there is only one way to do this.

Brian

2014-Nov-21 10:32:57 by johnkn:
You don't need to know the client version. 

    JOB_ROUTER_DEFAULTS = A=B; C=D;
    if version < 8.2.4
      JOB_ROUTER_DEFAULTS = [ $(JOB_ROUTER_DEFAULTS) ]
    endif

2014-Nov-21 11:22:17 by johnkn:
final result of all of the commits is that if 

    MERGE_JOB_ROUTER_DEFAULT_ADS = true

then the way to append to JOB_ROUTER_DEFAULTS is to append a full new-classad like this: 

    MERGE_JOB_ROUTER_DEFAULT_ADS = true
    JOB_ROUTER_DEFAULTS = [ A=Z; ]
    JOB_ROUTER_DEFAULTS = $(JOB_ROUTER_DEFAULTS) [ A=B; c=d; ]

If MERGE_JOB_ROUTER_DEFAULT_ADS is false, (which is the default value) the the way to append to the default ad is to just add ; terminated statements like this. 

    MERGE_JOB_ROUTER_DEFAULT_ADS = false
    JOB_ROUTER_DEFAULTS = A=Z;
    JOB_ROUTER_DEFAULTS = $(JOB_ROUTER_DEFAULTS) A=B; c=d;

2014-Dec-01 13:36:15 by tim:
We will release this without documentation. It is turned off by default. It is something requested by OSG that may turn out to be a temporary issue.
